main event: The documents contain several UFO sightings from different locations, including Arlington, Virginia, and Washington, D.C. The sightings describe unidentified objects appearing as stars, moving with no change in color, and being evaluated as stars by an astronomer.
interesting points: One sighting reported reddish-orange and pale pink objects surrounded by a bluish haze, traveling at high speeds and maneuvering abruptly in the sky.
A report describes a sighting lasting approximately two minutes of a hazy and indistinct object, possibly an Air Force aircraft, at an altitude of six to eight thousand feet.
Objects seen in the Arlington area appeared as stars and were evaluated as such by an astronomer from the U. S. Naval Observatory.
The objects in one report were observed for approximately one hour and fifteen minutes, seen through binoculars and by naked eye, and appeared to be orbiting in the area.
Reliability of the reporting agency in one instance is marked as unknown.
witnesses: various witnesses, including an astronomer and 1st Lt. Ray H. Hoffer of the USAF
